title: A salmonella outbreak is being linked to pet turtles
description: Half of the people infected in the outbreak reported having contact with turtle with shells smaller than four inches wide. Owning pet turtles of that size is prohibited by federal law.

title: In Maui, 850 people are still unaccounted for
description: The list of unaccounted for once contained more than 2,000 names, Maui County Mayor Richard Bissen said.

title: Pfizer's RSV vaccine to protect babies gets greenlight from FDA
description: The Food and Drug Administration has approved the first vaccine for expectant mothers to shield their babies from RSV.

title: This book dissects the years-long battle for gender equality at MIT
description: The few female scientists at MIT in the late 20th century found themselves faced with hurdles related to their gender rather than their research. So they did what scientists do: they quantified it.

title: NPR's podcast and programming chief Anya Grundmann to leave after 30 years
description: NPR's top programming executive, Anya Grundmann, will leave at the end of the year. She has overseen numerous hits for the network, including Tiny Desk.

title: Tropical Storm Hilary moves on from California, leaving a trail of damage and debris
description: The first tropical storm to hit Southern California in more than 80 years sparked road closures, school cancellations and power outages on Sunday evening before moving north to Nevada.

title: Monster hunters are conducting the largest search of Loch Ness in more than 50 years
description: There have been more than a thousand official sightings of the Loch Ness Monster, the Loch Ness Centre says. Nessie enthusiasts are deploying new tools this weekend to try and prove it's real.

title: He demanded higher ed for Afghan girls. He was jailed. Angelina Jolie targets his case
description: It's been 5 months since Matiullah Wesa, an activist who urged an end to Taliban bans on girls' education, was arrested. Media attention has faded. Now Angelina Jolie is making a plea in his behalf.

title: Latest on Ukraine: Russia strikes Chernihiv, as Kyiv welcomes F-16 pledges
description: Catch up on key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Spain's Olga Carmona learned her father had died after she won the Women's World Cup
description: "Yesterday was the best and the worst day of my life," wrote Carmona, who scored the only goal in Spain's historic win over England.

title: Up First briefing: Tropical Storm Hilary; Guatemala election; indoor air quality tips
description: Hilary drenches Southern California, flooding roads and closing schools. An anti-corruption crusader wins the presidency in Guatemala. Plus, how to optimize your air quality at home.

title: Rains slow as Hilary moves north and leaves Southern California underwater
description: As much as 7 inches of rain fell on parts of Southern California, leaving the region vulnerable to floods and mudslides as the rain eases and moves north.

title: Genesis Owusu follows up his successful debut album with 'Struggler'
description: Genesis Owusu has won just about every award he could in his home country of Australia with his debut album. Now with album number two, he's ready to take on America.

title: Massive mental health toll in Maui wildfires: 'They've lost everything'
description: Officials in Hawaii are scrambling to support the enormous and growing mental health needs of Maui residents traumatized by the deadliest wildfire in modern history

title: For one Texas doctor, abortion bans are personal and professional
description: Dr. Austin Dennard is an OB-GYN who is going to give birth very soon. She also had to leave Texas to terminate a previous pregnancy because the fetus had a fatal condition.

title: The Republican primary race is in full swing. NPR wants your election questions
description: The first Republican presidential primary debate is this Wednesday at 9 p.m. ET. Let us know what you want to know as the candidates take the stage.

title: Guatemala's anti-corruption candidate wins presidency in a landslide vote
description: In Guatemala, an anti-corruption candidate wins the run-off elections by a landslide, in a vote that was a critical test of the Central American country's democratic credentials.

title: Photos: See flooding, mudslides Tropical Storm Hilary brings to Southern Calif.
description: Residents across the region are being advised to stay home, if possible, and to expect road closures in flooded areas.
